page.title: 03THE ROAD TO LESWALT
page.content: The main Stranaer road leads past the large dairy farm of Auchneel with, above, The Dindinnie Reservoir. On the right is the Craichmore Golf Course, founded in 1902 and host to many competitions. The road arrives at Craigencross roundabout, once the property of the Knights of St. John. The left hand branch leads to Smithy Hill where once John Biggam, a local worthy and Blacksmith, served the needs fo the local farmers and cured childern's ailments. Straight on, the road passes, on the right, a former R.A.F. coal depot and, on the left, the wide stretches of Challoch (Blacksmith) Farm, house and steadings of considerable age. The village church dates from 1828, the school from 1873, and the old church yard has the Agnew Vault, the principal landowners.
